title: Ask HN: How to balance one's personal interest while wanting to be relevant?
text:
There are several paths/projects I'm interested in pursuing or are already pursuing that seem kinda niche, but a big part of me also really wants these things to be relevant to others, instead of just being a "me-thing".

What's your experience in navigating this tension between personal interest and relevance?

The advice I've seen so far have been pretty simplistic and I'm wondering if anyone has more substantial takes on it?

For example, how do you "soldier on" if/when feedback is bleak, or if you're met with blank faces? How do you maintain integrity without becoming completely irrelevant?

Ask HN: Why doesn't every home have an acceptable volume level for speech?
text:
Talking too loudly would result in a computer voice telling you to lower your voice.

If you do not comply after several warnings, an alarm will sound that would make conversation impossible for a few minutes.

title: Ask HN: How do I hide a user's comments?
text:
Hi,

I don't think HN has this capability so I was trying to craft something via ublock origin.

I added:

news.ycombinator.com##div:has(a[href*="user?id=example"])

however, that only hid the div where the user's name was shown, not the comment itself as that's in another subsequent div. Is there an argument I can pass so that it will hide the next div as well?

Some context on why I'm trying to achieve this - there's a small subset of users that insert political comments in highly interesting threads and I'm trying to avoid politics as much as possible so I'd like to "ban" those users by automatically hiding everything they say. I know it's a sledgehammer approach but the vast majority of HN content is extremely interesting and I really enjoy being part of the community.

Thank you.
